nodes.bodyText: This comment still valid?
javadoc
Maybe create its own server instead? Easier to find trace post run when servers aren't sharing servers.
Maybe say this should be using the LDAP registries default user filters for the LDAP server type.

The userFilter should be ignored if a loginProperty is defined. I would expect this test to verify that. There should be a warning issued noting that we are ignoring the userFilter if it is also defined explicitly.
Does this not apply if userFilter is used instead?
Ummmm.. are we just ignoring?

I meant the getUseEncodingInSearchExpression() and encodeAttribute(). Was that a stand-alone LDAP setting? Should we be checking whether to encode attributes whether the filter is statically or dynamically defined? The answer may be "no", but I am not sure.
Lets use braces around any if statements for maintainability.
I would just call this original configuration, and update the comment. This statement was copied from one of my original dynamic tests, and I now regret that I didn't have more generic descriptions.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                     * The original server configuration has no registry or Federated Repository configuration.
          
          
            
                     * Backup the original server configuration.
I would say that we define a user filter which allows a user to login with their CN to clarify the test.
Maybe say this test defines SN as a login property. It also define the userFilter. The user should be able to login with SN, but not CN and a warning should be thrown.
Add test before this to ensure the user can't login with CN. This way you verify that the loginProperty effectively cancels the userFilter.
I would probably just make this the same as the one above (use CN), and the key difference is NO userFilter was defined. It should perform identical to the test above I believe.

This one is using SN and CN, not UID. Maybe say that this one defines multiple login properties and NO user filter. I think all these test headers should kinda be documented the same:
Configuration:

UserFilter: not explicitly configured
LoginProperties: cn, sn

Expected Results

User can login with CN and SN, but not with UID (which is defined in the default user filter).

I think the negative test should be done for each attribute in all the other tests. SO we test login for UID, SN and CN in each test verifying that the positive and negative tests pass. Then you can remove this one.

Don't add it if it is not supported. I realize this will have no effect at this time, b/c we throw an exception below, but if we would change the flow for some reason to tolerate bad properties, this would make sure we don't add unsupported ones.
Make changes as we had talked about in slack.
